TopicTitle: What do you think about fact that NASA rename Dryden Research Center into Armstrong Flight Research Center

Articles.Content:
While Neil Armstrong was certainly the greatest and most inspiring human being that lived on earth but why this name changing?

Edited August 11, 2018 by Pawelk198604

There are finite facilities to name after people, at some point they reevaluate what’s named for which person. Half the cities in the country had old streets (often named after other historical figures) changed to be named for Martin Luther King, for example.

Probably only concerning to the relatives of the person whose name was displaced.

Edited August 11, 2018 by tater

Armstrong sounds punchier on headlines. I assume they're planning on needing to refer to the complex in press releases and want people to actually read them.

#Cynic

Spoiler

Never could get the whole idea to name something after somebody.

Always sounds either trivial or forgotten.

Edited August 12, 2018 by kerbiloid
